description: Inherited from Middle English paraf, from Medieval Latin paraffus or its etymon Middle French paraphe, paraffe, shortening of paragraphe.

entries.meaning: A flourish made after or below one's signature, originally to prevent forgery.
A mark used by medieval rubricators to indicate textual division.

verbs.description: paraph (third-person singular simple present paraphs, present participle paraphing, simple past and past participle paraphed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To add a paraph to; to sign, especially with one's initials.
